intro: Sebaea gracilis, commonly known as the slender sebaea, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, palmate leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Sebaea gracilis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas.
